trans-unit.source: . Before this fix PyGeoprocessing would crash with a TypeError on many operations.
trans-unit.target: . Before this fix PyGeoprocessing would crash with a TypeError on many operations.

trans-unit.source: . This is a change from prior behavior, when the diagnostic vectors were always created, which could occupy a lot of computational time under large outflow geometries.
trans-unit.target: . This is a change from prior behavior, when the diagnostic vectors were always created, which could occupy a lot of computational time under large outflow geometries.

trans-unit.source: . Fixes an issue where the number of processes could exponentiate if many processes were calling these functions.
trans-unit.target: . Fixes an issue where the number of processes could exponentiate if many processes were calling these functions.

trans-unit.target: . Scalars are no longer a special case and need to be passed as “raw” parameters.

trans-unit.source: A recent GDAL upgrade (might have been 2.0?) changed the reference to nearest neighbor interpolation from ‘nearest’ to ‘near’. This PR changes PyGeoprocessing to be consistent with that change.
trans-unit.target: A recent GDAL upgrade (might have been 2.0?) changed the reference to nearest neighbor interpolation from ‘nearest’ to ‘near’. This PR changes PyGeoprocessing to be consistent with that change.

trans-unit.source: API and functionality to aggregate across the FIDs of the aggregate vector. This is to be consistent with QGIS and other zonal statistics functionality. Additionally, fixed a bug where very small polygons might not get aggregated if they lie in the same pixel as another polygon that does not intersect it. The algorithm now runs in two passes:
trans-unit.target: API and functionality to aggregate across the FIDs of the aggregate vector. This is to be consistent with QGIS and other zonal statistics functionality. Additionally, fixed a bug where very small polygons might not get aggregated if they lie in the same pixel as another polygon that does not intersect it. The algorithm now runs in two passes:

trans-unit.source: API to take a raster/path band as an input rather than a path and a list of bands. Also removed the
trans-unit.target: API to take a raster/path band as an input rather than a path and a list of bands. Also removed the

trans-unit.source: Add an option to route_flux that lets the current pixel’s source be included in the flux, or not. Previous version would include on the source no matter what.
trans-unit.target: Add an option to route_flux that lets the current pixel’s source be included in the flux, or not. Previous version would include on the source no matter what.

trans-unit.source: Added a non-backwards compatible change by replacing the
trans-unit.target: Added a non-backwards compatible change by replacing the

trans-unit.source: Added a NullHandler so that users wouldn’t get an error that a logger handler was undefined.
trans-unit.target: Added a NullHandler so that users wouldn’t get an error that a logger handler was undefined.

trans-unit.source: Added an out-of-core high performance raster percentile function at pygeoprocessing.raster_band_percentile.
trans-unit.target: Added an out-of-core high performance raster percentile function at pygeoprocessing.raster_band_percentile.

trans-unit.source: Added basic filetype-specific assertions for many geospatial filetypes, and tests for these assertions. These assertions are exposed in
trans-unit.target: Added basic filetype-specific assertions for many geospatial filetypes, and tests for these assertions. These assertions are exposed in

trans-unit.source: Added file flushing and dataset swig deletion in reproject_datasource_uri to handle a race condition that might have been occurring.
trans-unit.target: Added file flushing and dataset swig deletion in reproject_datasource_uri to handle a race condition that might have been occurring.

trans-unit.source: Added functions to construct raster and vectors on disk from reasonable datatypes (numpy matrices for rasters, lists of Shapely geometries for vectors).
trans-unit.target: Added functions to construct raster and vectors on disk from reasonable datatypes (numpy matrices for rasters, lists of Shapely geometries for vectors).

trans-unit.source: Added relative numerical tolerance parameters to the PyGeoprocessing raster and csv tests with in the same API style as
trans-unit.target: Added relative numerical tolerance parameters to the PyGeoprocessing raster and csv tests with in the same API style as

trans-unit.source: Added support for very small AOIs that result in rasters less than a pixel wide. Additionally an
trans-unit.target: Added support for very small AOIs that result in rasters less than a pixel wide. Additionally an

trans-unit.source: Added updates to align dataset list that report which dataset is being aligned. This is helpful for logging feedback when many datasets are passed in that don’t take long enough to get a report from the underlying reproject dataset function.
trans-unit.target: Added updates to align dataset list that report which dataset is being aligned. This is helpful for logging feedback when many datasets are passed in that don’t take long enough to get a report from the underlying reproject dataset function.

trans-unit.source: Added watershed delineation routine to pygeoprocessing.routing.delineate_watershed. Operates on a DEM and point shapefile, optionally snaps outlet points to nearest stream as defined by a thresholded flow accumulation raster and copies the outlet point fields into the constructed watershed shapefile.
trans-unit.target: Added watershed delineation routine to pygeoprocessing.routing.delineate_watershed. Operates on a DEM and point shapefile, optionally snaps outlet points to nearest stream as defined by a thresholded flow accumulation raster and copies the outlet point fields into the constructed watershed shapefile.

trans-unit.source: Adding GDAL 3 support and dropping GDAL 2 support. The only non-backwards compatible issue in GDAL 2 to GDAL 3 is the need to handle Axis Ordering with osr.SetAxisMappingStrategy(osr.OAMS_TRADITIONAL_GIS_ORDER) because of https://trac.osgeo.org/gdal/wiki/rfc73_proj6_wkt2_srsbarn#Axisorderissues?. Since Axis ordering now matters for Geographic CRS the expected order is Lat,Lon but we use osr.OAMS_TRADITIONAL_GIS_ORDER to swap to Lon,Lat.
trans-unit.target: Adding GDAL 3 support and dropping GDAL 2 support. The only non-backwards compatible issue in GDAL 2 to GDAL 3 is the need to handle Axis Ordering with osr.SetAxisMappingStrategy(osr.OAMS_TRADITIONAL_GIS_ORDER) because of https://trac.osgeo.org/gdal/wiki/rfc73_proj6_wkt2_srsbarn#Axisorderissues?. Since Axis ordering now matters for Geographic CRS the expected order is Lat,Lon but we use osr.OAMS_TRADITIONAL_GIS_ORDER to swap to Lon,Lat.

trans-unit.source: Adding MinGW-specific compiler flags for statically linking pygeoprocessing binaries against libstdc++ and libgcc. Fixes an issue on many user’s computers when installing from a wheel on the Python Package Index without having two needed DLLs on the PATH, resulting in an ImportError on pygeoprocessing.geoprocessing_core.pyd.
trans-unit.target: Adding MinGW-specific compiler flags for statically linking pygeoprocessing binaries against libstdc++ and libgcc. Fixes an issue on many user’s computers when installing from a wheel on the Python Package Index without having two needed DLLs on the PATH, resulting in an ImportError on pygeoprocessing.geoprocessing_core.pyd.

trans-unit.source: Adding Python 3.8 support and dropping Python 3.6 support.
trans-unit.target: Adding Python 3.8 support and dropping Python 3.6 support.

trans-unit.source: Adding a GitHub Actions-based build job for building wheels and a source distribution for a given commit of pygeoprocessing.
trans-unit.target: Adding a GitHub Actions-based build job for building wheels and a source distribution for a given commit of pygeoprocessing.

trans-unit.source: Adding a pavement script with routines to fetch SVN test data, build a virtual environment, and clean the environment in a Windows based operating system.
trans-unit.target: Adding a pavement script with routines to fetch SVN test data, build a virtual environment, and clean the environment in a Windows based operating system.

trans-unit.source: Adding all pygeoprocessing.geoprocessing functions to pygeoprocessing.__all__, which allows those functions to appear when calling help(pygeoprocessing).
trans-unit.target: Adding all pygeoprocessing.geoprocessing functions to pygeoprocessing.__all__, which allows those functions to appear when calling help(pygeoprocessing).

trans-unit.source: Adding automated testing via bitbucket pipelines.
trans-unit.target: Adding automated testing via bitbucket pipelines.

trans-unit.source: Adding error checking to ensure that
trans-unit.target: Adding error checking to ensure that

trans-unit.source: Adding routing_core.pxd to the manifest. This fixes an issue where some users were unable to compiler pygeoprocessing from source.
trans-unit.target: Adding routing_core.pxd to the manifest. This fixes an issue where some users were unable to compiler pygeoprocessing from source.

trans-unit.source: All functions that create rasters expose the underlying GeoTIFF options through a default parameter
trans-unit.target: All functions that create rasters expose the underlying GeoTIFF options through a default parameter

trans-unit.source: Be careful, many of the parameter orders have been changed and renamed. Generally inputs come first, outputs last. Input parameters are often prefixed with “base_” while output parameters are prefixed with “target_”.
trans-unit.target: Be careful, many of the parameter orders have been changed and renamed. Generally inputs come first, outputs last. Input parameters are often prefixed with “base_” while output parameters are prefixed with “target_”.

trans-unit.source: Changed default compression routine for GeoTIFFs to ZSTD (thanks Facebook https://facebook.github.io/zstd/).
trans-unit.target: Changed default compression routine for GeoTIFFs to ZSTD (thanks Facebook https://facebook.github.io/zstd/).

trans-unit.source: Changed optional parameters involving layer indexes to be either indexes or string ids. In all cases changing
trans-unit.target: Changed optional parameters involving layer indexes to be either indexes or string ids. In all cases changing

trans-unit.source: Changing default raster creation compression algorithm from LZW to DEFLATE, this is to address issues where we were seeing recreatable, but unexplainable LZWDecode errors in large raster data.
trans-unit.target: Changing default raster creation compression algorithm from LZW to DEFLATE, this is to address issues where we were seeing recreatable, but unexplainable LZWDecode errors in large raster data.

trans-unit.source: Correcting an issue with the docstring in
trans-unit.target: Correcting an issue with the docstring in

trans-unit.source: Created a history file to document current and previous releases.
trans-unit.target: Created a history file to document current and previous releases.

trans-unit.source: Defaulting compression algorithm back to LZW as ZSTD is not a widely implemented compression standard for geotiffs.
trans-unit.target: Defaulting compression algorithm back to LZW as ZSTD is not a widely implemented compression standard for geotiffs.

trans-unit.source: Exposed cython routing functions so they may be imported from C modules.
trans-unit.target: Exposed cython routing functions so they may be imported from C modules.

trans-unit.source: Exposing GeoTIFF creation options for all the
trans-unit.target: Exposing GeoTIFF creation options for all the

trans-unit.source: Exposing a parameter and setting reasonable defaults for the number of processes to allocate to
trans-unit.target: Exposing a parameter and setting reasonable defaults for the number of processes to allocate to

trans-unit.source: Fixed a bug in convolve_2d that would not
trans-unit.target: Fixed a bug in convolve_2d that would not

trans-unit.source: Fixed a bug on the test that determines if a raster should be memory blocked. Rasters were not getting square blocked if the memory block was row aligned. Now creates 256x256 blocks on rasters larger than 256x256.
trans-unit.target: Fixed a bug on the test that determines if a raster should be memory blocked. Rasters were not getting square blocked if the memory block was row aligned. Now creates 256x256 blocks on rasters larger than 256x256.

trans-unit.source: Fixed a bug that caused some nodata values to not be treated as nodata if there was a numerical roundoff.
trans-unit.target: Fixed a bug that caused some nodata values to not be treated as nodata if there was a numerical roundoff.

trans-unit.source: Fixed a compilation issue on Mac OS X Catalina related to the compilation of a template in the file iteration component of the out-of-core percentile function.
trans-unit.target: Fixed a compilation issue on Mac OS X Catalina related to the compilation of a template in the file iteration component of the out-of-core percentile function.

trans-unit.source: Fixed a defect in pygeoprocessing.routing.calculate_transport where the nodata types were cast as int even though the base type of the routing rasters were floats. In extreme cases this could cause a crash on a type that could not be converted to an int, like an
trans-unit.target: Fixed a defect in pygeoprocessing.routing.calculate_transport where the nodata types were cast as int even though the base type of the routing rasters were floats. In extreme cases this could cause a crash on a type that could not be converted to an int, like an

trans-unit.source: Fixed a handful of docstring errors.
trans-unit.target: Fixed a handful of docstring errors.

trans-unit.source: Fixed a library wide issue relating to the underlying numpy types of GDT_Byte Datasets. Now correctly identify the signed and unsigned versions and removed all instances where code used to mod byte data to unsigned data and correctly creates signed/unsigned byte datasets during resampling.
trans-unit.target: Fixed a library wide issue relating to the underlying numpy types of GDT_Byte Datasets. Now correctly identify the signed and unsigned versions and removed all instances where code used to mod byte data to unsigned data and correctly creates signed/unsigned byte datasets during resampling.

trans-unit.source: Fixed a memory error issue that could occur on multiple flow direction flow accumulation calculations.
trans-unit.target: Fixed a memory error issue that could occur on multiple flow direction flow accumulation calculations.

trans-unit.source: Fixed a memory issue for DEMs on the order of 25k X 25k, still may have issues with larger DEMs.
trans-unit.target: Fixed a memory issue for DEMs on the order of 25k X 25k, still may have issues with larger DEMs.

trans-unit.source: Fixed an incomparability with GDAL 1.11.3 bindings that expects a boolean type in
trans-unit.target: Fixed an incomparability with GDAL 1.11.3 bindings that expects a boolean type in

trans-unit.source: Fixed an issue in all functionality that used a cutline polygon with invalid geometry which would cause a crash. This was caused by gdal.Warp when using the cutline functionality. Instead this functionality was replaced with manual rasterization. In turn this introduces two optional parameters:
trans-unit.target: Fixed an issue in all functionality that used a cutline polygon with invalid geometry which would cause a crash. This was caused by gdal.Warp when using the cutline functionality. Instead this functionality was replaced with manual rasterization. In turn this introduces two optional parameters:

trans-unit.source: Fixed an issue in distance transform where a vertical striping artifact would occur in the masked region of some large rasters when distances should be 0.
trans-unit.target: Fixed an issue in distance transform where a vertical striping artifact would occur in the masked region of some large rasters when distances should be 0.

trans-unit.source: Fixed an issue in reclassify_dataset_uri that would cause an exception if the incoming raster didn’t have a nodata value defined.
trans-unit.target: Fixed an issue in reclassify_dataset_uri that would cause an exception if the incoming raster didn’t have a nodata value defined.

trans-unit.source: Fixed an issue on reclassifying signed byte rasters that had negative nodata values but the internal type stored for vectorize datasets was unsigned.
trans-unit.target: Fixed an issue on reclassifying signed byte rasters that had negative nodata values but the internal type stored for vectorize datasets was unsigned.

trans-unit.source: Fixed an issue so tox correctly executes on the repository.
trans-unit.target: Fixed an issue so tox correctly executes on the repository.

trans-unit.source: Fixed an issue that could cause some custom arguments to geotiff creation options to be ignored.
trans-unit.target: Fixed an issue that could cause some custom arguments to geotiff creation options to be ignored.

trans-unit.source: Fixed an issue that could cause the distance transform to be incorrect when the sampling distance was in the noninclusive range of (0.0, 1.0).
trans-unit.target: Fixed an issue that could cause the distance transform to be incorrect when the sampling distance was in the noninclusive range of (0.0, 1.0).

trans-unit.source: Fixed an issue that would cause the bounding box generated by
trans-unit.target: Fixed an issue that would cause the bounding box generated by

trans-unit.source: Fixed an issue when “None” was passed in on new raster creation that would attempt to directly set that value as the nodata value in the raster.
trans-unit.target: Fixed an issue when “None” was passed in on new raster creation that would attempt to directly set that value as the nodata value in the raster.

trans-unit.source: Fixed an issue where NETCDF files incorrectly raised Exceptions in
trans-unit.target: Fixed an issue where NETCDF files incorrectly raised Exceptions in

trans-unit.source: Fixed an issue where flat regions, such as reservoirs, that could only drain off the edge of the DEM now correctly drain as opposed to having undefined flow directions.
trans-unit.target: Fixed an issue where flat regions, such as reservoirs, that could only drain off the edge of the DEM now correctly drain as opposed to having undefined flow directions.

trans-unit.source: Fixed an issue where in some cases different nodata values for ‘signal’ and ‘kernel’ would cause incorrect convolution results in
trans-unit.target: Fixed an issue where in some cases different nodata values for ‘signal’ and ‘kernel’ would cause incorrect convolution results in

trans-unit.source: Fixed an issue where int32 dems with INT_MIN as the nodata value were being treated as real DEM values because of an internal cast to a float for the nodata type, but a cast to double for the DEM values.
trans-unit.target: Fixed an issue where int32 dems with INT_MIN as the nodata value were being treated as real DEM values because of an internal cast to a float for the nodata type, but a cast to double for the DEM values.

trans-unit.source: Fixed an issue where rasters that had undefined nodata values caused striping in the reclassify_dataset_uri function.
trans-unit.target: Fixed an issue where rasters that had undefined nodata values caused striping in the reclassify_dataset_uri function.

trans-unit.source: Fixed an issue where reproject_datasource_uri would add geometry that couldn’t be projected directly into the output datasource. Function now only adds geometries that transformed without error and reports if any features failed to transform.
trans-unit.target: Fixed an issue where reproject_datasource_uri would add geometry that couldn’t be projected directly into the output datasource. Function now only adds geometries that transformed without error and reports if any features failed to transform.

trans-unit.source: Fixed an issue with reclassify dataset that would occur when small rasters whose first memory block would extend beyond the size of the raster thus passing in “0” values in the out of bounds area. Reclassify dataset identified these as valid pixels, even though vectorize_datsets would mask them out later. Now vectorize_datasets only passes memory blocks that contain valid pixel data to its kernel op.
trans-unit.target: Fixed an issue with reclassify dataset that would occur when small rasters whose first memory block would extend beyond the size of the raster thus passing in “0” values in the out of bounds area. Reclassify dataset identified these as valid pixels, even though vectorize_datsets would mask them out later. Now vectorize_datasets only passes memory blocks that contain valid pixel data to its kernel op.

trans-unit.source: Fixed malformed logging outputs which could be seen during long running
trans-unit.target: Fixed malformed logging outputs which could be seen during long running

trans-unit.source: Fixes an unnecessary calculation that pre-fills slope raster GeoTIFFs with nodata values.
trans-unit.target: Fixes an unnecessary calculation that pre-fills slope raster GeoTIFFs with nodata values.

trans-unit.source: Fixing LICENSE.TXT to .txt issue that keeps reoccurring.
trans-unit.target: Fixing LICENSE.TXT to .txt issue that keeps reoccurring.

trans-unit.source: Fixing a memory leak in block caches that held on to dataset, band, and block references even after the object was destroyed.
trans-unit.target: Fixing a memory leak in block caches that held on to dataset, band, and block references even after the object was destroyed.

trans-unit.source: Fixing a memory leak with large polygons when calculating disjoint set.
trans-unit.target: Fixing a memory leak with large polygons when calculating disjoint set.

trans-unit.source: Fixing a rare race condition where an exception could occur in
trans-unit.target: Fixing a rare race condition where an exception could occur in

trans-unit.source: Fixing an issue with aggregate_raster_values that caused a crash if feature IDs were not in increasing order starting with 0.
trans-unit.target: Fixing an issue with aggregate_raster_values that caused a crash if feature IDs were not in increasing order starting with 0.

trans-unit.source: Fixing an issue with versioning where ‘dev’ was displayed instead of the version recorded in pygeoprocessing/__init__.py.
trans-unit.target: Fixing an issue with versioning where ‘dev’ was displayed instead of the version recorded in pygeoprocessing/__init__.py.

trans-unit.source: Fixing issue that caused “LICENSE.TXT not found” during pip install.
trans-unit.target: Fixing issue that caused “LICENSE.TXT not found” during pip install.

trans-unit.source: Fixing issue with automatic versioning scheme.
trans-unit.target: Fixing issue with automatic versioning scheme.

trans-unit.source: Functions that take rasters as inputs must have their rasters aligned before the call to that function. The function
trans-unit.target: Functions that take rasters as inputs must have their rasters aligned before the call to that function. The function

trans-unit.source: Hotfix patch to address an issue in watershed delineation that doesn’t pack the target watershed output file. Half the shapefile consists of features polygonalized around nodata values that are flagged for deletion, but not removed from the file. This patch packs those features and returns a clean watershed.
trans-unit.target: Hotfix patch to address an issue in watershed delineation that doesn’t pack the target watershed output file. Half the shapefile consists of features polygonalized around nodata values that are flagged for deletion, but not removed from the file. This patch packs those features and returns a clean watershed.

trans-unit.source: Hotfix patch to remove upper bound on required numpy version. This was causing a conflict with InVEST’s looser requirement. Requirement is now set to >=1.13.0.
trans-unit.target: Hotfix patch to remove upper bound on required numpy version. This was causing a conflict with InVEST’s looser requirement. Requirement is now set to >=1.13.0.

trans-unit.source: Hotfix that fixes an issue that would cause
trans-unit.target: Hotfix that fixes an issue that would cause

trans-unit.source: Hotfix to correctly cite Natural Capital Project partners in license and update the copyright year.
trans-unit.target: Hotfix to correctly cite Natural Capital Project partners in license and update the copyright year.

trans-unit.source: Hotfix to fix an issue with
trans-unit.target: Hotfix to fix an issue with

trans-unit.source: Hotfix to patch an infinite loop when aggregating upstream or downstream with custom rasters.
trans-unit.target: Hotfix to patch an infinite loop when aggregating upstream or downstream with custom rasters.

trans-unit.source: Hotfix to patch an issue that gave incorrect results in many PyGeoprocessing functions when a raster was passed with an NoData value. In these cases the internal raster block masks would blindly pass through on the first row since a test for
trans-unit.target: Hotfix to patch an issue that gave incorrect results in many PyGeoprocessing functions when a raster was passed with an NoData value. In these cases the internal raster block masks would blindly pass through on the first row since a test for

trans-unit.source: Hotfix to patch an issue with watershed delineation packing that causes some field values to lose precision due to default field widths being set.
trans-unit.target: Hotfix to patch an issue with watershed delineation packing that causes some field values to lose precision due to default field widths being set.

trans-unit.source: Hotfixed a bug that would cause numpy arrays to be treated as broadcastable even if they were passed in “raw”.
trans-unit.target: Hotfixed a bug that would cause numpy arrays to be treated as broadcastable even if they were passed in “raw”.

trans-unit.source: If a raster path is specified and operation requires a single band, argument is passed as a “(path, band)” tuple where the band index starts at 1 as convention for raster bands.
trans-unit.target: If a raster path is specified and operation requires a single band, argument is passed as a “(path, band)” tuple where the band index starts at 1 as convention for raster bands.

trans-unit.source: If you import pygeoprocessing and see a ValueError: numpy.dtype has the wrong size, try recompiling, this is the result of a version compatibility issue with the numpy API in the precompiled pygeoprocessing binaries. The solution is to recompile pygeoprocessing on your computer:
trans-unit.target: If you import pygeoprocessing and see a ValueError: numpy.dtype has the wrong size, try recompiling , this is the result of a version compatibility issue with the numpy API in the precompiled pygeoprocessing binaries. The solution is to recompile pygeoprocessing on your computer:

trans-unit.source: Improved logging for long runtimes in
trans-unit.target: Improved logging for long runtimes in

trans-unit.source: Individual functions for raster and vector properties have been aggregated into
trans-unit.target: Individual functions for raster and vector properties have been aggregated into

trans-unit.source: Intra-package imports are now relative. Addresses an import issue for users with multiple copies of pygeoprocessing installed across multiple Python installations.
trans-unit.target: Intra-package imports are now relative. Addresses an import issue for users with multiple copies of pygeoprocessing installed across multiple Python installations.

trans-unit.source: More informative error messages raised on incorrect bounding box mode.
trans-unit.target: More informative error messages raised on incorrect bounding box mode.

trans-unit.source: Non-backwards compatible refactor of core PyGeoprocessing geoprocessing pipeline. This is to in part expose only orthogonal functionality, address runtime complexity issues, and follow more conventional GIS naming conventions. Changes include:
trans-unit.target: Non-backwards compatible refactor of core PyGeoprocessing geoprocessing pipeline. This is to in part expose only orthogonal functionality, address runtime complexity issues, and follow more conventional GIS naming conventions. Changes include:

trans-unit.source: Note the pip-installable requirements in requirements.txt are for best results, but older package versions may also work. If necessary, PyGeoprocessing can be installed without dependencies with pip install --no-deps.
trans-unit.target: Note the pip-installable requirements in requirements.txt are for best results, but older package versions may also work. If necessary, PyGeoprocessing can be installed without dependencies with pip install --no-deps .

trans-unit.source: Now using natcap.versioner for versioning instead of local versioning logic.
trans-unit.target: Now using natcap.versioner for versioning instead of local versioning logic.

trans-unit.source: Numerous API changes from the 0.3.x version of PyGeoprocessing.
trans-unit.target: Numerous API changes from the 0.3.x version of PyGeoprocessing.

trans-unit.source: Package logger objects are now identified by python hierarchical package paths (e.g. pygeoprocessing.routing)
trans-unit.target: Package logger objects are now identified by python hierarchical package paths (e.g. pygeoprocessing.routing)

trans-unit.source: PyGeoprocessing is a Python/Cython based library that provides a set of commonly used raster, vector, and hydrological operations for GIS processing. Similar functionality can be found in ArcGIS/QGIS raster algebra, ArcGIS zonal statistics, and ArcGIS/GRASS/TauDEM hydrological routing routines.
trans-unit.target: PyGeoprocessing is a Python/Cython based library that provides a set of commonly used raster, vector, and hydrological operations for GIS processing. Similar functionality can be found in ArcGIS/QGIS raster algebra, ArcGIS zonal statistics, and ArcGIS/GRASS/TauDEM hydrological routing routines.

trans-unit.source: PyGeoprocessing is developed at the Natural Capital Project to create a programmable, open source, and free Python based GIS processing library to support the InVEST toolset. PyGeoprocessing’s design prioritizes computation and memory efficient runtimes, easy installation and cross compatibility with other open source and proprietary software licenses, and a simplified set of orthogonal GIS processing routines that interact with GIS data via filename. Specifically the functionally provided by PyGeoprocessing includes:
trans-unit.target: PyGeoprocessing is developed at the Natural Capital Project to create a programmable, open source, and free Python based GIS processing library to support the InVEST toolset. PyGeoprocessing’s design prioritizes computation and memory efficient runtimes, easy installation and cross compatibility with other open source and proprietary software licenses, and a simplified set of orthogonal GIS processing routines that interact with GIS data via filename. Specifically the functionally provided by PyGeoprocessing includes:

trans-unit.source: PyGeoprocessing now supports Python 2 and 3, and is tested on python 2.7 and 3.6 Testing across multiple versions is configured to be run via
trans-unit.target: PyGeoprocessing now supports Python 2 and 3, and is tested on python 2.7 and 3.6 Testing across multiple versions is configured to be run via

trans-unit.source: Pygeoprocessing is now tested against Python 3.7.
trans-unit.target: Pygeoprocessing is now tested against Python 3.7.

trans-unit.source: Pygeoprocessing package tests can be run by invoking
trans-unit.target: Pygeoprocessing package tests can be run by invoking

trans-unit.source: Raster creation defaults now set “COMPRESS=LZW” for all rasters created in PyGeoprocessing, including internal temporary rasters. This option was chosen after profiling large raster creation runs on platter hard drives. In many cases processing time was dominated by several orders of magnitude as a write-to-disk. When compression is turned on overall runtime of very large rasters is significantly reduced. Note this otherwise increases the runtime small raster creation and processing by a small amount.
trans-unit.target: Raster creation defaults now set “COMPRESS=LZW” for all rasters created in PyGeoprocessing, including internal temporary rasters. This option was chosen after profiling large raster creation runs on platter hard drives. In many cases processing time was dominated by several orders of magnitude as a write-to-disk. When compression is turned on overall runtime of very large rasters is significantly reduced. Note this otherwise increases the runtime small raster creation and processing by a small amount.

trans-unit.source: Refactoring source side to migrate source files from [REPO]/pygeoprocessing to [REPO]/src/pygeoprocessing.
trans-unit.target: Refactoring source side to migrate source files from [REPO]/pygeoprocessing to [REPO]/src/pygeoprocessing.

trans-unit.source: Removed “create_rat/create_rat_uri” and migrated it to natcap.invest.wind_energy; the only InVEST model that uses that function.
trans-unit.target: Removed “create_rat/create_rat_uri” and migrated it to natcap.invest.wind_energy; the only InVEST model that uses that function.

trans-unit.source: Removed extract_band_and_nodata function since it exposes the underlying GDAL types.
trans-unit.target: Removed extract_band_and_nodata function since it exposes the underlying GDAL types.

trans-unit.source: Removed most of the pygeoprocessing.testing module and added the following convenience functions to
trans-unit.target: Removed most of the pygeoprocessing.testing module and added the following convenience functions to

trans-unit.source: Removed reclassify_by_dictionary since reclassify_dataset_uri provided almost the same functionality and was widely used.
trans-unit.target: Removed reclassify_by_dictionary since reclassify_dataset_uri provided almost the same functionality and was widely used.

trans-unit.source: Removed the class OrderedDict that was not used.
trans-unit.target: Removed the class OrderedDict that was not used.

trans-unit.source: Removed the function calculate_value_not_in_dataset since it loaded the entire dataset into memory and was not useful.
trans-unit.target: Removed the function calculate_value_not_in_dataset since it loaded the entire dataset into memory and was not useful.

trans-unit.source: Removing GDAL, Shapely from the hard requirements in setup.py. This will allow pygeoprocessing to be built by package managers like pip without these two packages being installed. GDAL and Shapely will still need to be installed for pygeoprocessing to run as expected.
trans-unit.target: Removing GDAL, Shapely from the hard requirements in setup.py. This will allow pygeoprocessing to be built by package managers like pip without these two packages being installed. GDAL and Shapely will still need to be installed for pygeoprocessing to run as expected.

trans-unit.source: Removing a temporary working directory that is created when executing pygeoprocessing.convolve_2d.
trans-unit.target: Removing a temporary working directory that is created when executing pygeoprocessing.convolve_2d.

trans-unit.source: Renamed all parameters involving Spatial Projections to the form
trans-unit.target: Renamed all parameters involving Spatial Projections to the form

trans-unit.source: Renamed test suite to be consistent with the pattern
trans-unit.target: Renamed test suite to be consistent with the pattern

trans-unit.source: Resolved a compilation issue on Mac OS X (Mavericks and later) where pygeoprocessing would not compile unless some additional compiler and linker flags were provided. These are now accounted for in the package’s compilation steps in
trans-unit.target: Resolved a compilation issue on Mac OS X (Mavericks and later) where pygeoprocessing would not compile unless some additional compiler and linker flags were provided. These are now accounted for in the package’s compilation steps in

trans-unit.source: Several PyGeoprocessing functions now take advantage of multiple CPU cores:
trans-unit.target: Several PyGeoprocessing functions now take advantage of multiple CPU cores:

trans-unit.source: Shapefile paths are assumed to operate on the first layer. It is so rare for a shapefile to have more than one layer, functions that would be confused by multiple layers have a layer_index that defaults to 0 that can be overridden in the call.
trans-unit.target: Shapefile paths are assumed to operate on the first layer. It is so rare for a shapefile to have more than one layer, functions that would be confused by multiple layers have a layer_index that defaults to 0 that can be overridden in the call.

trans-unit.source: This release marks a feature-complete version of PyGeoprocessing with a full suite of routing and geoprocessing capabilities.
trans-unit.target: This release marks a feature-complete version of PyGeoprocessing with a full suite of routing and geoprocessing capabilities.

trans-unit.source: Updated docstring on get_lookup_from_table to indicate the headers are case insensitive.
trans-unit.target: Updated docstring on get_lookup_from_table to indicate the headers are case insensitive.

trans-unit.source: Updates to reclassify_dataset_uri to use numpy.digitize rather than Python loops across the number of keys.
trans-unit.target: Updates to reclassify_dataset_uri to use numpy.digitize rather than Python loops across the number of keys.

trans-unit.source: Using osr.CreateCoordinateTransformation() instead of osr.CoordinateTransformation() as the GDAL 3 call.
trans-unit.target: Using osr.CreateCoordinateTransformation() instead of osr.CoordinateTransformation() as the GDAL 3 call.

trans-unit.source: Warped signed byte rasters are now also signed byte rasters.
trans-unit.target: Warped signed byte rasters are now also signed byte rasters.

trans-unit.source: a simplified hydrological routing library (D8inf/MFD flow direction, plateau drainage, weighted and unweighted flow accumulation, and weighted and unweighted flow distance)
trans-unit.target: a simplified hydrological routing library (D8inf/MFD flow direction, plateau drainage, weighted and unweighted flow accumulation, and weighted and unweighted flow distance)

trans-unit.source: a suite of raster manipulation functions (warp, align, raster calculator, reclassification, distance transform, convolution, and fast iteration)
trans-unit.target: a suite of raster manipulation functions (warp, align, raster calculator, reclassification, distance transform, convolution, and fast iteration)

trans-unit.source: a suite of vector based manipulation function (zonal statistics, rasterization, interpolate points, reprojection, and disjoint polygon sets)
trans-unit.target: a suite of vector based manipulation function (zonal statistics, rasterization, interpolate points, reprojection, and disjoint polygon sets)

trans-unit.target: can now take numpy arrays and scalar values along with raster path band tuples. Arrays and scalars are broadcast to the raster size according to numpy array broadcasting rules.

trans-unit.source: cpus to calculate separable convolutions per block while using the main thread to aggregate and write the result to the target raster. In practice we saw this improve runtimes by about 50% for large rasters.
trans-unit.target: cpus to calculate separable convolutions per block while using the main thread to aggregate and write the result to the target raster. In practice we saw this improve runtimes by about 50% for large rasters.

trans-unit.source: no longer checks the string equality for projections or geotransforms. Instead it only checks raster size equality. This fixes issues where users rasters DO align, but have a slightly different text format of the WKT of projection. It also abstracts the problem of georeferencing away from raster_calculator that is only a grid based operation.
trans-unit.target: no longer checks the string equality for projections or geotransforms. Instead it only checks raster size equality. This fixes issues where users rasters DO align, but have a slightly different text format of the WKT of projection. It also abstracts the problem of georeferencing away from raster_calculator that is only a grid based operation.

trans-unit.source: where the dialect was unable to be detected when analyzing a CSV that was larger than 1K in size. This fix enables the correct detection of comma or semicolon delimited CSV files, so long as the header row by itself is not larger than 1K.
